name: getAutomationsId
description: Get a summary of an individual classic automation workflow's settings and content. The `trigger_settings` object returns information for the first email in the workflow.

fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

exclude_fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

workflow_id.description: The unique id for the Automation workflow.

$block: A summary of an individual Automation workflow's settings and content.

$ul: **_links**: A list of link types and descriptions for the API schema documents.
**create_time**: The date and time the Automation was created in ISO 8601 format.
**emails_sent**: The total number of emails sent for the Automation.
**id**: A string that identifies the Automation.
**recipients**: List settings for the Automation.
**list_id**: The unique list id.
**list_is_active**: The status of the list used, namely if it's deleted or disabled.
**list_name**: List Name.
**segment_opts**: An object representing all segmentation options.

**conditions**: Segment match conditions. There are multiple possible types, see the [condition types documentation](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/alternative-schemas/#segment-condition-schemas).
**match**: Segment match type.
**saved_segment_id**: The id for an existing saved segment.
**store_id**: The id of the store.
**report_summary**: A summary of opens and clicks for sent campaigns.
**click_rate**: The number of unique clicks, divided by the total number of successful deliveries.
**clicks**: The total number of clicks for an campaign.
**open_rate**: The number of unique opens divided by the total number of successful deliveries.
**opens**: The total number of opens for a campaign.
**subscriber_clicks**: The number of unique clicks.
**unique_opens**: The number of unique opens.
**settings**: The settings for the Automation workflow.
**authenticate**: Whether Mailchimp [authenticated](https://mailchimp.com/help/about-email-authentication/) the Automation. Defaults to `true`.
**auto_footer**: Whether to automatically append Mailchimp's [default footer](https://mailchimp.com/help/about-campaign-footers/) to the Automation.
**from_name**: The 'from' name for the Automation (not an email address).
**inline_css**: Whether to automatically inline the CSS included with the Automation content.
**reply_to**: The reply-to email address for the Automation.
**title**: The title of the Automation.
**to_name**: The Automation's custom 'To' name, typically the first name [audience field](https://mailchimp.com/help/getting-started-with-merge-tags/).
**use_conversation**: Whether to use Mailchimp Conversation feature to manage replies
**start_time**: The date and time the Automation was started in ISO 8601 format.
**status**: The current status of the Automation.
**tracking**: The tracking options for the Automation.
**capsule**: Deprecated
**notes**: Update contact notes for a campaign based on a subscriber's email addresses.
**clicktale**: The custom slug for [ClickTale](https://mailchimp.com/help/additional-tracking-options-for-campaigns/) tracking (max of 50 bytes).
**ecomm360**: Whether to enable e-commerce tracking.
**goal_tracking**: Deprecated
**google_analytics**: The custom slug for [Google Analytics](https://mailchimp.com/help/integrate-google-analytics-with-mailchimp/) tracking (max of 50 bytes).
**html_clicks**: Whether to [track clicks](https://mailchimp.com/help/enable-and-view-click-tracking/) in the HTML version of the Automation. Defaults to `true`.
**opens**: Whether to [track opens](https://mailchimp.com/help/about-open-tracking/). Defaults to `true`.
**salesforce**: Deprecated
**campaign**: Create a campaign in a connected Salesforce account.
**notes**: Update contact notes for a campaign based on a subscriber's email address.
**text_clicks**: Whether to [track clicks](https://mailchimp.com/help/enable-and-view-click-tracking/) in the plain-text version of the Automation. Defaults to `true`.
**trigger_settings**: Available triggers for Automation workflows.
**runtime**: A workflow's runtime settings for an Automation.
**days**: The days an Automation workflow can send.
**hours**: The hours an Automation workflow can send.
**type**: When to send the Automation email.
**workflow_emails_count**: The number of emails in the Automation workflow.
**workflow_title**: The title of the workflow type.
**workflow_type**: The type of Automation workflow.

$block: An error generated by the Mailchimp API. Conforms to IETF draft 'draft-nottingham-http-problem-06'.

$ul: **detail**: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. [Learn more about errors](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Errors).
**instance**: A string that identifies this specific occurrence of the problem. Please provide this ID when contacting support.
**status**: The HTTP status code (RFC2616, Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.
**title**: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It shouldn't change based on the occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.
**type**: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type. When dereferenced, it should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type.
